alert.note: Alert for Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 08 at 1:45PM EDT until August 09 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding of streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations are occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall, so additional areas may flood through this evening. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Maine, including the following counties, in south central Maine, Kennebec and Sagadahoc. In southwest Maine, Androscoggin, Cumberland and York. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. Small stream flooding will continue through this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 140 PM EDT, Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen, with an additional inch possible through this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Portland, Lewiston, South Portland, Auburn, Biddeford, Brunswick, Augusta, Westbrook, Bath and Gardiner.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
